title: Gopal Bhengra:Gopal Bhengra Represented India At The Top Level In Hockey, After Retirement He Could Barely Afford To Buy Vegetables
text:
Gopal Bhengra is not a name that will raise your eyebrows. And why should it? Most of us have no clue who he is, let alone what he played. In fact the writer of this article also shamefully admits that until a couple of years ago, even he was oblivious to the existence of such a man.

So who is he? Gopal was a hockey player who has represented India at the top level. He was part of the team which took part in the 1978 World Cup. Now one would expect him to get some recognition, right? Wrong! Sadly Gopal's tale is no different than most Indian athletes who have been forgotten.

Jaagran

In 1979, he left the army. The man knocked on the doors of ministers, bureaucrats and businessmen hoping to get the job of at least a peon. With no help coming he took the job of crushing stones which fetched him Rs 50 per day. His monthly pension of Rs 1475 was hardly enough for him to buy vegetables later in life.

In 2017, there was some respite when Sunil Gavaskar reached out to him. His CHAMPS Foundation ensures that Gopal gets a cheque of Rs 7500 per month. While all that is well and good now, the fact remains that for nearly 4 decades he was ignored by the very country for whom he gave it all.

Jaagore

He's not alone and joins a sad group of athletes who were ignored once their value as athletes was gone. No wonder most youngsters opt for cricket as there is some safety and security even when you have stopped playing the game.
